author: jsign
content: "any of the three parties were to make the contract public": by that you mean someone post the code bytecode on-chain in a txn? (e.g: as calldata or blob?)

author: sky.cactus
content: Posts it anywhere that someone other than Alice, Bob, or Carol can see it.

author: sky.cactus
content: This could include on-chain, or off-chain.

author: jsign
content:
The on-chain commitment is the root of that merkle tree. 
If Bob publishes the code on-chain, then Alice or Carol can generate a merkle proof that proves Bob was part of the deal. And the fact that the on-chain txn has his signature (of the code) makes him responsible for slashing?
Naive-ish solution since why on earth Alice, Bob or Carol would post on-chain a signed transaction with the bytecode.

author: jsign
content: I'd expect you're looking for a way for each of them to have a unique representation of the contract, such that if that is leaked it can uniquely identify "which of them" made the leak?

author: sky.cactus
content: The goal is to make it so you can identify *who* leaked the contract.
